Generation VII.Sun: The excess energy that bathes this Pokémon keeps it in constant danger of overflow. It can't sustain a battle over long periods of time.
Generation VII.Moon: Due to the effects of Mega Evolution, its pincers have taken on a more diabolical form, ripping anything they pinch to shreds.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: It stores the excess energy from Mega Evolution, so after a long time passes, its body starts to melt.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: It's better at beating things than grasping them. When it battles for a long time, the weight of its pincers becomes too much to bear.

Generation VIII.Sword: Bulky pincers account for one third of Scizor's body weight. A single swing of one of these pincers will crush a boulder completely.
Generation VIII.Shield: Though its body is slim, Scizor has tremendous attacking power. Even Scizor's muscles are made of metal.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It has a steel-hard body. It intimidates foes by upraising its eye-patterned pincers.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It has a steel-hard body. It intimidates foes by upraising its eye-patterned pincers.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: Evolved by way of a curious item . The shell covering its body has been shown to be stronger than forged steel.
